results.name: Triangle A000012 * A135225, read by rows.
link: G. C. Greubel, Rows n = 0..100 of triangle, flattened
formula: A000012 * A135225 as infinite lower triangular matrices. Left border of 1's in Pascal's Triangle (A007318) is replaced with a column of (1,2,3,...).
T(n,k) = binomial(n,k), with T(n,0) = n+1. - _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
example: First few rows of the triangle are:
maple: seq(seq( `if`(k=0, n+1, binomial(n,k)), k=0..n), n=0..12); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
mathematica: Table[If[k==0, n+1, Binomial[n, k]], {n, 0, 12}, {k, 0, n}]//Flatten (* _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019 *)
program: (PARI) T(n,k) = if(k==0, n+1, binomial(n,k)); \\ _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
(MAGMA) [k eq 0 select n+1 else Binomial(n,k): k in [0..n], n in [0..12]]; // _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
[[T(n, k) for k in (0..n)] for n in (0..12)] # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
Flat(List([0..12], n-> List([0..n], k-> T(n,k) ))); # _G. C. Greubel_, Nov 20 2019
